meanings.definition: To divide (a document or book) into pages.
meanings.sent1: I will paginate the report to make it easier to read.
meanings.sent2: She decided to paginate the novel before printing it.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to paginate their essays for submission.
meanings.sent4: In order to paginate the magazine, the editor had to carefully plan the layout.
meanings.sent5: The secretary had to paginate the lengthy document for the meeting.

meanings.definition: To number the pages of (a document or book).
meanings.sent1: Please paginate the manual so we can refer to specific sections easily.
meanings.sent2: The librarian will paginate the new books before shelving them.
meanings.sent3: The author forgot to paginate the manuscript, causing confusion for the readers.
meanings.sent4: It is important to paginate legal documents to keep them organized.
meanings.sent5: The printer will paginate the pages before binding the book.

meanings.definition: To turn pages in a document or book.
meanings.sent1: I will paginate through the magazine to find the article.
meanings.sent2: She likes to paginate quickly when reading a novel.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to paginate the picture book upside down, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: As she tried to paginate the old diary, the pages crumbled in her hands.
meanings.sent5: He would paginate through the atlas, dreaming of far-off lands.
